reviewText: I'm updating my first review on this DVD, because this workout has really grown on me. It's gentle and not very intense, but I do feel it (especially in my hips and outer thighs-areas that I don't work on much in other workouts, and in my upper arms and triceps-diamond pushups anyone?!).The best part about Fusion Flow is that I feel amazingly calm, but engerzied afterward. Ellen Barrett has no equal when it comes to de-stressing, endorphin-releasing workouts! I save this workout for lighter days in between more intense workouts and it leaves me feeling refreshed, rejuvenated and excited to work out again the next day--instead of feeling worn down and exhausted.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a nice, easy and effective workout.  It seems to focus on inner thigh and waist mostly.  The problems with the DVD are that Barrett fails to identify which body part you are working (for those who are beginners or don't know already) or should be focused on and rarely discusses form (stomach in, etc.)  There is no workout for the abs and very little for abs.  After it was over, although it did make me sweat, I felt as if I needed to work my abs and arms more and maybe do more leg exercises (outer thigh, quad, etc.)  Today's instructors seem to pretend that you are working all muscles or most at one time - and you really aren't.  Thus, lose the word "fusion" and all the other fancy newer words that pretend the workout is something other than what it is.  It is very good, but could be better.
summary: Good, Easy, Effective for Inner Thighs and Waist but no ab work
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was a great find for me from a library used book sale!  I was a little hesitant to try it, as I've had Ellen Barrett workouts in the past (none from her Studio line), and I've never really clicked with them, despite how warm and genuine Ellen seems.  However, I liked the idea of workout combining yoga-ish moves with a bit of sculpting and toning, no equipment needed.Ellen instructs this workout live (she provides excellent mirrored cuing) in a large, open studio with two background exercisers, Michelle and Natalie (Natalie modifies some of the exercises).  The Main Menu offers options for Play All and Chapter Selection.  All this DVD is chaptered, there are no pauses between chapters within the workout itself--as Ellen repeatedly states, everything is done in a flow.  However, I have broken down the workout sections by chapter for the purpose of this review.Warm-Up, 6.5 minutesEllen moves through a nice series of gentle stretches, repeating the entire series once from the beginning.  The exercises include shoulder rolls, elbow circles, back stroke, side reaches, criss-cross arms, criss-cross arms in squat, hip pulses, and side-to-side hip slides.  I really liked that the hips and low back got some attention here.Half Moon Stretch Series, 5 minutesThis was a ballet-like segment.  Ellen begins with plies, adding in a one-arm reach and releve onto the toes.  Coming down into a held plie, she performs shoulder rotations to work the arms and then a heel lift to work the leg.  The series is then repeated on the other side and with both arms/legs.Ribcage Reach Series, 10.5 minutesThis section got my heart rate up a bit, especially towards the end.  Ellen starts with a simple ribcage reach to either side, speeding this up and changing it into a zig-zag (reaching up then down).  She then adds side-to-side lunges with airplane arms and a lunge "burst" to the side.  After repeating to the other side, she holds the lunge to one side and performs little kicks, a balancing pendulum, and punches front.Dancer Lunge Series, 8 minutesHere Ellen begins with a lunge held to the front, then to the side, then alternating.  She then moves into some plank, cobra, and push-up work before finishing on the other side.Seated Side Series, 11 minutesThis segment consists of seated pretzel work, but it also includes moves such as a side diamond push-up and a mermaid stretch.  Exercises are performed all on one side before switching to the other side.Finishing Mat Work, 4 minutesEllen opens this last section with some quick seated cat/cow stretches.  This is followed by knee drops to either side, adding in an extension of the top leg; a butterfly flutter concludes the workout.I expected FUSION FLOW to be an easy, gentle routine--it was definitely relaxing, but it also gave me a bit of a workout, including just under 10 minutes in my target heart rate zone.  This DVD would be ideal as a light-day workout, a recovery workout, a Friday night workout, or a morning workout.  Ellen might flow a bit too fast for brand-new beginners to exercise, both otherwise, I think that this 45-minute workout will appeal to a wide audience, and I definitely recommend it.
summary: Great combination of stretching and toning to fit a variety of fitness needs!

reviewText: This dvd was ok. It was a very relaxing workout and I felt stretched out. Ellen is a really nice instructor and doesn't move too fast. You do sweat, but not much. reviewText: How many times can I say that I love the Ellen Barrett DVDs?  Many times!  She's the best.  She's a "normal" type of fit.  Not too skinny, not bulky, just toned, long and lean.  It's an attainable goal for nearly everyone, and she helps you to reach it.

reviewText: This is really a great workout!  I've had this dvd on my wishlist for some time now and when the price dropped I decided it was time to try it out.  I just love so many of Ellen Barrett's dvds.  Her dvds are different then the regular cardio workouts out there and they really do work!  This workout I did watch a clip online and thought ok this looks like an easy workout.  Well this workout will have you sweating and feeling it all day long.  My only dislike on this dvd is the background music would've preferred something else.  This workout is about 45 mins long and it sure didn't feel like it!  I highly recommend this workout dvd for all fitness levels.  I can't wait to get my next Ellen Barrett dvd!

reviewText: Got this one to use during Phase 1 (which you'll be familiar with if you read 28 Days Lighter).  It is great for this - deceptively challenging (as Ellen loves to say) - seems easy but you will break a sweat and not realize how hard you're working because it feels so good (though the dancer lunge series is hard!! :))  I use this and her Crunch Super Slim Down for my Phase 1 workouts.
summary: Great for Phase 1 of 28 Days Lighter Diet plan!!

reviewText: i just got this today- and since i'm starting back into working out- i did just the first series Half moon series and the later matwork. i loved loved loved the half moon series- its like Ballet class all over again. very simple cardio based moves but i felt them as i was doing them.  BUT for those of you who never did ballet dont worry Ellen explains and there are great camera angles showing you what to do and how to have your arms and legs etc. i have a feeling this will be on my weekly favorite list! it was very fun but just challenging enough plus enough encouragement to keep me from losing interest. its simple all you need is floor and its all you.  i'm looking forward to some of Ellens other workouts too!.

reviewText: I used to be an avid "Firmie" who loved doing the old Firm workouts.  I'm in my mid-30s now and with 3 small children I can't do "hardcore" workouts anymore and still have energy left for the rest of the day.  Thanks to Ellen, I've learned you don't need to beat yourself up to get a good workout (my scale is confirming this!).  I look forward to doing her DVDs and this new one is no exception.  The best way I can describe it is ballet mixed with pilates with just a touch of yoga. I feel like I get stretched, toned, and relaxed all in one workout!  How many other DVDs can you say that with?  I love Ellen as an instructor too.  She is motivating without being irritating.
summary: Effective workout that's light and easy on my joints!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout actually makes me feel beautiful while I am doing it!  How many other workouts can you say that about?  As her other workouts, I like the combination of ballet, yoga and pilates.  Even though you are not panting and sweating at the end of her workouts, they really do build endurance and cardio capacity.  The other day, I tried out a workout touted everywhere it seems as being really cardio and weight-training intensive - made it through, no problem.  It should be work out smarter, not harder and you definitely work out smarter with Ellen.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Few other instructors can match Ellen's skill at blending strengthening and stretch moves. Her fluid series of moves just feel so good for your muscles. You work them hard, but without building up the tension that creates tightness after so many other workouts. If you are a dancer, you will find that these moves improve the grace and fluidity of your dancing. If you are not a dancer, you will feel more like a dancer every time you do the workout.If you already own other Ellen Barrett DVD's, you will be happy to know that there are a number of very unique and creative moves on this one. The short "burst" segments that are included to help release tension from the muscles include hip sways, as well as a pulsing movement done in a low squat position that looks very uncomfortable and unappealing, but which is wonderful for loosening up the hips. Another unique move is the cobra with the chest/ shoulder lifted to the side at an angle, rather than straight up.As always, Ellen gives many crucical pointers about body position and about where you should feel the work. Both the music and Ellen's vocal style are soothing, and she does not talk excessively.
summary: Masterful blend of strengthening and stretching
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ellen Barrett often refers to her "quest to create the perfect workout" in her productions and literature - and her quest is the perfect match for MY quest for challenging workouts that raise my heart rate, work every muscle group in multiple planes of movement, create lean/long musculature, stretch and elongate areas of tension and holding, are fun to do, AND fit into my schedule.  Almost all her Studio workouts are around 45 minutes of continuous, low-impact movement that meet all my workout needs.Fusion Flow is fabulous!  Its challenging because it never stops - each exercise flows into the next, building the intensity over time.  There are lots of shoulder and hip openers in this, with lots of good, controlled range of motion exercises that work multiple muscle groups at once.  30 mins is all standing flow, and the last 15 is some focused hip, glute and ab work on the mat - but no crunches here!  Even the more targeted moves that isolate "problem areas" are paired with fun, fluid movement that allows some room for some expressive, dance-inspired creativity (if you are into that).I am really a big fan of Ellen - her Studio workouts are intelligent and fun, and more challenging than her Crunch stuff.  She give great cuing, and her personality is just right for my style - encouraging and genuine, without the fake pep or bootcamp-y shrillness of some other instructors.  Plus, I always FEEL great during and after her routines.  I am appreciative of such high-quality work, and am glad she created The Studio!
summary: Ellen's workouts are the best of all worlds!
